Name: Crossroads
Quote: The crossroads mark the changing of ways, the opening of endless possibilities.

Name: Anvil
Quote: The hammer strikes down upon the anvil with divine force, forging arms for the gods at Targo's firm grip.

Name: Empty Throne
Quote: When Rhowan of Arkovia abdicated his throne, the seat of power remained vacant until the fall of the once great nation as its oligarchs bickered amongst themselves for power.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: 10% Pierce Resistance
Bonus to All Pets: 10% Chaos Resistance
Bonus to All Pets: 10% Aether Resistance

Name: Falcon
Quote: The falcon's sharp gaze scans the skies for easy prey.

Name: Hammer
Quote: The hammer strikes down upon the anvil with divine force, forging arms for the gods at Targo's firm grip.

Name: Harpy
Quote: The harpy represents dark omens. To be born under her light is seen as a sign of shame, driving some families to abandon such children altogether.

Name: Owl
Quote: The owl represents wisdom and scholarly pursuits. Spellwork is believed to be more potent under the gaze of the owl.

Name: Shepherd's Crook
Quote: The shepherd guides his celestial flock across the night sky.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: 15% Elemental Resistance
Bonus to All Pets: +5% Health, +5% Defensive Ability

Name: Wolverine
Quote: The wolverine represents untamed ferocity.

Bonus to All Pets: +5% Defensive Ability

Name: Fiend
Quote: The fiend hides in the darkness of the void, hungry for wayward stars to extinguish.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: +15% Fire Damage
Bonus to All Pets: +15% Fire Damage

Name: Ghoul
Quote: The ghoul embodies corruption and decay, its counterpart is the dryad.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 3% of Attack Damage converter to Health
x% Attack Damage converted to Health

Name: Jackal
Quote: The jackal skulks through the sky, searching for easy pickings.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: +5% Attack Speed

Name: Rat
Quote: The plague rat skitters across the night sky, careful to avoid the gaze of the falcon and hawk.

Name: Viper
Quote: The viper represents the flow of energy between the living world and the aether, which powers all forms of magic.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 15% Chance of 36 Energy Leech over 2 Seconds
20% Reduced target's Elemental Resistances for 3 Seconds

Name: Vulture
Quote: The vulture represents disorder and chaos, its counterpart is the crane.

Name: Akeron's Scorpion
Quote: Akeron was doomed to walk the desert until dead, but fate intervened in the form of a scorpion which led the sun-dazed mortal to water. Akeron survived his sentence and returned to take revenge upon those who had left him to die with the use of scorpion venom.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Reduce Target's Defensive Ability by x

Name: Bat
Quote: The vampiric bat easily finds its way across the night sky, hunting for flickers of lost stars to sap of their light.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 15% Chance of x Vitality Decay over 2 Seconds
3% of Attack Damage converted to Health
x% Attack Damage converted to Health

Name: Eye of the Guardian
Quote: Dreeg, the witch god, is said to have peered beyond the veil and witnessed the truth of all things. For that, the gods have cursed his mortal form into a spined abomination with a thousand lidless eyes. He now stands immortal guard over the veil, his peerless gaze ever watchful for those who would dare follow in his stead.

Name: Fox
Quote: The wily fox leaps playfully across the night sky.

Name: Hawk
Quote: The hawk soars through the heavens, seeking its next meal.

Name: Raven
Quote: The raven represents guile. It is for this reason that the witch gods have taken favor in ravens as their familiars and messengers.

Name: Scholar's Light
Quote: The scholar's light glows brightly when sleep-deprived scholars are still working under the dim glow of their candles.

Name: Spider
Quote: The spider weaves its web in the night sky, trapping rogue stars for the gods to weave into their celestial tapestry.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 20% reduced Attack Speed Retaliation for 3 Seconds

Name: Assassin's Blade
Quote: The assassin's dagger, the favored tool of the sanctioned killer.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Reduce Target's Physical & Pierce Resistances by x%

Name: Crane
Quote: The crane represents harmony and peace, its counterpart is the vulture.

Name: Dryad
Quote: The dryad embodies nature's spirit and purity, her counterpart is the ghoul.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Poison & Bleeding Duration Reduced by x%

Name: Lion
Quote: The lion represent bravery, valor, the birth of kings.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: +12% Total Damage

Name: Panther
Quote: The panther represents spiritual strength and dexterity.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: +2% Offensive Ability
Bonus to All Pets: +6% to All Damage
Bonus to All Pets: +3% Offensive Ability
Bonus to All Pets: +5% Crit Damage

Name: Tortoise
Quote: The tortoise represents fortitude and unyielding dedication.

Name: Bull
Quote: The bull charges across the night sky with determination and strength.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: +15% Internal Trauma Damage with +20% Increased Duration
8% Chance of Stun target for 0.7 Seconds
x Internal Trauma Damage over 2 seconds

Name: Eel
Quote: The eel glides gently across the night sky, its slick form impossible to grasp.

Name: Gallows
Quote: The gallows is a solemn sign of passed judgement and deadly portents.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 15% Chance of 100 Life Leech Retaliation over 2 Seconds

Name: Hound
Quote: The loyal hound awaits the call of its celestial masters, ever eager to follow the huntress onto another hunt.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: +30% Total Retaliation Damage

Name: Imp
Quote: The imp is a trickster, its constellation flickering in and out of view throughout the year.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: x% Chance of Confuse target for 2 Seconds

Name: Lizard
Quote: The lizard was one of the first spawn of the celestial Tree of Life, the forefather of all reptiles.

Name: Sailor's Guide
Quote: The sailor's guide serves as a celestial marker for those lost at sea. Its guiding light has saved many a sailor braving the tumultuous waters.

Name: Tsunami
Quote: The tsunami marks the most dangerous time of the year to take to the great seas, with frequent storms and devastating waves ruining many an expedition. Wise captains plan their journeys to avoid the storm season.

Name: Wraith
Quote: The wraith roams the skies for all eternity, its final judgement by Ulcama never passed.

Name: Affliction
Quote: The appearance of the affliction in the sky, following the great feast of the Autumn Boar, marks the beginning of the cold months, when disease and decay turn Cairn into a bleak contrast to the prosperous months of harvest.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: x Vitality Decay Retaliation over 3 seconds
x Vitality Decay Retaliation over 3 Seconds

Name: Amatok the Spirit of Winter
Quote: In the winter months this constellation appears on the northern horizon. It is said that travelers in desperation who follow the guiding star of Amatok may come upon his lodge. Those who enter will be allowed to sit at his blazing hearth and share in a bountiful feast but those who are foolish, Amatok will flay and prepare as his feast on the following night.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: x% Chance to Freeze for 1 Seconds
x% Slower target Movement for 3 Seconds

Name: Assassin
Quote: The assassin, the celestial executioner is rarely seen in the night sky. Its arrival is often cloaked in thick clouds, from which it emerges for brief moments before disappearing once more into the veil.

Name: Autumn Boar
Quote: The autumn boar's arrival in the sky marks the beginning of a celebration of the fall season and the changing of the leaves. The event begins with a great hunt and ends with a feast that lasts until the meat and beer run dry.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 10% Chance of 2100 Bleeding Retaliation over 3 Seconds
% Chance of Knockdown target for x seconds

Name: Behemoth
Quote: The behemoth serves the gods, endlessly moving and shifting the countless stars in the sky at their command.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to all Pets: Increase Health Regeneration by 20%

Name: Berserker
Quote: The berserker is the wild and untamed matron of war. She represents strength and ferocity.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 15% Chance of +50% Bleeding Damage with +100% Increased Duration

Name: Blades of Nadaan
Quote: Nadaan is the guardian of thieves and assassins. The appearance of his blades in the sky is often interpreted as a sign of ill omen; that an evil, but necessary, act is about to be carried out.

Name: Bysmiel's Bonds
Quote: It is said that Bysmiel, the witch god, was headed to the gallows when he abandoned his mortal form and ascended into the heavens, his broken chains the only sign of his escape.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: 15% Total Damage
Bonus to All Pets: 8% Total Speed
Bonus to All Pets: 20% Vitality Resistance
Bonus to All Pets: 20% Total Damage, +8% Health

Name: Chariot of the Dead
Quote: The chariot of the dead gathers wayward souls and delivers them to their final judgement across the veil.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Wayward Soul (100% when hit by Crit)

Name: Crab
Quote: The crab marks the beginning of the most prosperous fishing season of the year, but also one of the most dangerous as the larger spawns of the sea come closer to shore following the migration patterns of the smaller fish and crabs.

Name: Dire Bear
Quote: The dire bear is a symbol of pride and physical might. Those born under its light are said to descend from the kings of old.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: x% Chance of Stun for 1.5 Seconds

Name: Harvestman's Scythe
Quote: The scythe represents bounty and the time of harvests. It shines brightest in the hottest months, before giving way to the Autumn Boar.

Name: Huntress
Quote: The huntress roams the night sky, stalking her celestial prey. It is said that her eternal hunt will end when at last she slays the immortal hydra.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: +5% Offensive Ability

Name: Hydra
Quote: The mythical beast roams the night sky, immortal and imposing. Its many heads are said to regrow within moments.

Name: Kraken
Quote: Sea captains are known to refuse voyage if the Kraken is bright in the sky without the light of the Sailor's Guide to protect them.

Name: Magi
Quote: The magi is the patron of all practitioners of magic. Those born under his gaze are said to be blessed, or cursed depending on the point of view, with unparalleled control over arcane forces.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: x Burn Damage over y seconds
x% Chance to Stun target for y Seconds

Name: Manticore
Quote: The manticore is a vicious predator that roams the night sky in search of its next meal. Its bite and tail are filled with venom.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: x Reduced Target's Armor for 5 seconds
x% Reduced Target's Resistances for 5 seconds

Name: Messenger of War
Quote: The messenger of war is a symbol of fear and tyranny. The messenger rides across the starry void, heralding in a new age of conflict and strife.

Name: Oklaine's Lantern
Quote: Oklaine, is the guardian of mages and sorcerers. It is said that his guiding light serves as a beacon when traversing the veil between reality and the aether.

Name: Revenant
Quote: The revenant represents death and misery. It is said that none can escape its deathly gaze, not even the gods themselves.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 10% Chance of 40 Energy Leech over 2 Seconds

Name: Rhowan's Crown
Quote: It is said that when Rhowan of Arkovia abdicated his throne, his crown and scepter were quickly lost, only to be found in the night sky the following day.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: 20% Elemental Damage
Bonus to All Pets: 10% Elemental Resistances
x Reduced target's Elemental Resistances for 2 seconds

Name: Rhowan's Scepter
Quote: It is said that when Rhowan of Arkovia abdicated his throne, his crown and scepter mysteriously disappeared, only to be found in the night sky the following day.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 5% Chance of Stun target for 1 second

Name: Scales of Ulcama
Quote: Ulcama, the judge, presides over the heavens and judges the lives of all mortals. It is said that all of a person's deeds are placed upon his golden scales, and should the evils of their life outweigh the good, their spirit is forever banished into the void.

Name: Shieldmaiden
Quote: The shieldmaiden stands guard over the stars, so that none leave their celestial positions without the behest of the gods.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 15% Chance of 1 Seconds of Stun Retaliation

Name: Solael's Witchblade
Quote: Solael is said to be the most cruel of the three witch gods, having carved open countless victims with his curved sacrificial blade in his mad pursuit of immortality.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 10% Energy Burn (50% of Energy Burnt Causes Damage)

Name: Solemn Watcher
Quote: Symon, the watcher, stood guard at Symon's Ward til his dying day, protecting the empire from supernatural threats. Symon's eternal vigil continues in the celestial sky, watching over Cairn as he did in life.

Name: Targo the Builder
Quote: Targo is the patron of craftsmen and architects, the god believed to have created the celestial tapestry upon which all stars now rest.

Name: Tempest
Quote: The tempest is said to shine brightest when a dangerous storm looms on the horizon. Children born during a thunderstorm are believed marked for great things.

Name: Ulo the Keeper of the Waters
Quote: Ulo represents the endless cycle and unstoppable flow of water, renewing all the rivers of the world and in turn the lakes and the seas.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: 10% Elemental Resistance
Bonus to All Pets: 20% Poison & Acid Resistance
Bonus to All Pets: 10% Chaos Resistance

Name: Wendigo
Quote: The wendigo is a primal hunger spirit. Many shamans go against their very teachings and try to make a pact with wendigos in the hope of invoking the vile spirits upon their enemies; but wendigos are ultimately very perilous to control and have driven many  shamans mad, filling them with an insatiable hunger that inevitably leads to cannibalism.

Name: Widow
Quote: The widow mourns for the lost and the dead. When streaks of light mark the night sky, they are said to be the widow's tears.

Name: Abomination
Quote: Golgoran, the abomination, represents humanity's basest instincts, fear of death and shadows, the desire to have what you have not. The abomination embodies all that turns man wicked.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: % Physical Damage converted to Chaos Damage

Name: Aeon's Hourglass
Quote: Aeon is known as the keeper of time, the master of fate's thread. It is by his judgement that mortals are born and die. His symbol is the hourglass.

Name: Blind Sage
Quote: Many would travel thousands of miles to seek out the wisdom of the great blind sage, but most would leave unsatisfied, their souls undeserving of her ageless wisdom.

Name: Dying God
Quote: In an age preceding the creation of the mortal planes, an elder god was betrayed by his children; his body torn apart and drained of blood so that they could use its power to breathe life into their own creations. His remains were cast out of creation into a void but, incapable of death, the god lingered on in the darkness, doomed to an eternity of pain and madness; feeling the suffering and death of all mortal things that were given life from his blood. His name forgotten by time, the dying god is known only as Ch'thon; he who dwells below creation.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: +30% to All Damage, +5% Attack Speed
Bonus to All Pets: 30% Total Damage, 10% Crit Damage
% Chance of 3 Seconds of Terrify Retaliation
% Chance of Stun Target for 1 Second
% Chance of 30% Slow Target for 3 Seconds

Name: Leviathan
Quote: The great serpent in the sky, devourer of stars and deliverer of the cold chill of night.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: x% Slower target Movement for 2 Seconds

Name: Light of Empyrion
Quote: Empyrion, the greatest among the gods, is the light of the world and protector of all of Cairn. It is by his mercy and example that the sun greets mankind each day.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: Increases Current Elemental Resistance by 10%
Bonus to All Pets: 15% Elemental Resistance
Bonus to All Pets: 20% Vitality Resistance
Pet Bonus: 15% Aether Resistance, 15% Chaos Resistance
Light of Empyrion (20% when Hit by Melee Attacks)
% Chance to Confuse Target for 3 Seconds
x Reduces targets Armor for y Seconds

Name: Mogdrogen the Wolf
Quote: A titan created during the war of the gods, Mogdrogen has become the god of beasts and is said to roam the wild reaches of Cairn. Legends claim Mogdrogen is a shapeshifter, usually seen as a giant wolf but occasionally taking other forms, even that of a human. Mogdrogen roams the far reaches of Cairn, guarding the wilds against the encroachment of civilization.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: +5% Offensive Ability
Bonus to All Pets: +30% Total Damage
Bonus to All Pets: 6% Total Speed
Bonus to All Pets: +40% Total Damage
15% chance of reduced target's Defensive Ability

Name: Obelisk of Menhir
Quote: Menhir, god of the earth, is a steadfast protector of Cairn. He is prayed to equally both by men eager to defend their home and farmers hoping for a bountiful crop. Ancient stone monoliths mark sacred grounds of Menhir to this day.

Name: Oleron
Quote: Tragic is the tale of Oleron, who would come to be known as the war god. When faced with the destruction of his nation, Oleron made the difficult choice to rise to the defense of his people, but the victory cost him his wife and only child. The loss weighed heavily upon the war hero, and legends say that he would charge recklessly into battle since that day, seeking death upon a foe's blade so that he could be reunited with his family. But the bittersweet release had never come. To this day, when soldiers charge into battle, they call upon Oleron's name to grant them strength and courage.

Name: Spear of the Heavens
Quote: The Spear of the Heavens is the celestial symbol of power. It is said that the Spear was wielded by Empyrion himself when he smote down the Dying God and shattered the deity into a thousand-thousand pieces.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Spear of the Heavens (50% when Hit)

Name: Tree of Life
Quote: Legends say that when the world was first born from the darkness of the void, a single tree was planted which would come to bear all the fruit and animals of the world.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: Bonus to All Pets: Increases Health Regeneration by 20%
Bonus to All Pets: Increases Health Regeneration by 20%
Bonus to All Pets: +50 Health Regenerated per second

Name: Ulzuin's Torch
Quote: Ulzuin the Betrayed was once a god of healing and ceremonies, but millennia of torment following a most grisly betrayal from his lover has twisted the once benevolent entity into a bitter deity interested only in vengeance and destruction.

Name: Unknown Soldier
Quote: Many a legend are told about the nameless men and women who were felled in battle, their valor and deeds never acknowledged. In honor of their sacrifice, the stars themselves were rearranged to form the Unknown Soldier.

StatisticsBonuses.Text: 3% of Attack Damage converted to Health
Living Shadow (100% Chance on Critical Attack)
